title.text: XML/XSL in the Dictionary: The Case of Discourse Markers

abstractContent.text: We describe our ongoing work on an application of XML/XSL technology to a dictionary, from whose source representation various views for the human reader as well as for automatic text generation and understanding are derived.
Our case study is a dictionary of discourse markers, the words (often, but not always, conjunctions) that signal the presence of a disocurse relation between adjacent spans of text.
